page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT /CHURCHES/SPORT
page.content: Mining was an important industry here in the past,the pits being found to the south along the valley of the Ellen.These have all been worked out and the only mining that takes place locally is open-cast to the immediate south-west and this provides some employment. There are three policemen resident in Aspatria and there is a fire station which is manned by volunteers who are summoned by an electronic buzzer they carry at all times. There is a Parish Church called St. Kentigern's and this belongs to the Church of England.There is also a Methodist or United Reformed Chapel. The sports facilities at the secondary school are used by the community especially the open-air swimming pool. The Memorial Park was laid out to
